items

Interface Item

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Consumable, Weapon
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractConsumable, AbstractTimedConsumable, AbstractWeapon, Dagger, DefensePotion, Fist, HealthPotion, ShortSword

    public interface Item
    This interface ties both the Weapon and Consumable item trees together, and it contains the statements .equals(), .getName(), .setName(), and .toString().
    Author:
    Dr. Cheese

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(Item other)
      Checks if this item is equal to another item by comparing the names and every stat.
      java.lang.String getName()
      This gets the name of the item and returns it.
      void setName(java.lang.String newName)
      This sets the name of the item to something new.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Lets the reader know what the item is, and what it does.

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        boolean equals(Item other)
        Checks if this item is equal to another item by comparing the names and every stat.
        Parameters:
        other - The other item to check.
        Returns:
        True if the name and all stats are equal, or false if otherwise.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        This gets the name of the item and returns it.
        Returns:
        the name of the item.

      • setName

        void setName(java.lang.String newName)
        This sets the name of the item to something new.
        Parameters:
        newName - The new name for the item.

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Lets the reader know what the item is, and what it does.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the name, type, and function of the item.
